Hi Gina,

If you are surting manually, you could try uncommenting "seedsAsS=
urtPrefixes" and setting it to "false". I think what may be happening is it=
 is creating an additional surt for your seeds, and that setting will be a =
little more flexible with scoping. It is designed so that you provide a url=
 like http://example.com/index.html <http://example.com/index.html> and it =
will try to create a surt for you. In this case the surt would be "(com,exa=
mple,)/", so that may explain the unexpected one-level-higher surts.

~Adam=


> On Dec 23, 2014, at 7:01 AM, 'Jones, Gina' gjon@... [archive-crawle=
r] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> 
> I have been crawling an=
 archive for digitalpreservation.gov/formats <http://digitalpreservation.go=
v/formats> for several years now and really depend on surts to keep the cra=
wler focused. 
> 
>  
> 
> I=E2=80=99ve been working with 3.2 for a month o=
r so now, and am curious about a current crawl that I am doing.    
> 
> Ex=
cerpt from crawler beans
> 
> <bean id=3D"acceptSurts" class=3D"org.archive=
.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPrefixedDecideRule">
> 
>   <property name=3D=
"decision" value=3D"ACCEPT"/>

ixes" value=3D"true" /> -->

ue=3D"false" /> -->
>

s.txt" />
> 
>  
> 
>  
> 
> I am running a crawl that is going beyond the =
boundary I specified in my surts.txt but not beyond the surts.dump, my deci=
de rule is fine.  The problem that I think I am seeing is that 3.2 is takin=
g my surts.txt and not keeping my specificity for some strings.  I don=E2=
=80=99t remember seeing this same behavior in 3.2 when I specified seeds an=
d surts in the crawler beans or even when I specified surts in the crawler =
beans.   I expect to keep the specificity of surts when the crawler beans s=
pecifies a surts.txt file to use.
> 
>  
> 
> Not finding anything that sai=
d that the surts.txt > surts.dump does anything diffe rent in 3.2.  What am=
 I missing?  
> 
>  
>
